title: Drawing, Inkstand for the Viceroy Eugene de Beauharnais of Italy, ca. 1810
title_raw: Inkstand for the Viceroy Eugene de Beauharnais of Italy
medium: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on off-white laid paper
markings: Recto and Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
inscribed:
Inscription at left: Li grifi di brosso dorato e festone/ li bassi rilievi in fondo turchino/ e figure bianche in Mosaicho devono/ figurarle li otto pianeti del Cielo/ Le quatro/ stagioni base/ di Gialli piantati/ di colonna di marmo biancho/ Piantato ove e il tiratore fondo/ Sabro dove cornice/ di gialli festoni/ e cornici delle Medaglie in bronso/ dorato e Dettaglio della cornice sopra il/ Fregio ossia della cimara dell'/ architrave andante. Il listello/ introdotto fra il guscio e l'ovolo/ e necessario per dividere gl'intagli/ dei due membri acio non si confondono. 
The scales: "Scale di Palmi due per il Detaglio" and "Scala di Palmi Romani Architectonici"
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Intended to be executed in marble and gilt bronze. Below, an oblong pedestal, upon three steps supported by calices. Alternative designs are suggested for the protruding corners of the pedestal. Above these are standing women with cornucopias. The front of the pedestal is decorated like an entablature; in the frieze hang festoons with circular portrait medallions above them. In the center is an oblong pedestal with two griffins disposed obliquely at the corners, carrying a festoon. Between them is a tablet with relief showing two women, the left of whom wears a crescent in her hair. Above, sculpture in the round of two seated captives supporting a globe, showing Europe, upon their shoulders. At top, Saturn stands on one foot, supporting a dial marked with Roman numerals. Plan at upper right and inscription throughout.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Inkstand for the Viceroy Eugene de Beauharnais of Italy, ca. 1810; Designed by Giuseppe Barberi (Italian, 1746–1809); Italy; pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on off-white laid paper; 42.7 x 31.8 cm (16 13/16 x 12 1/2 in.); Museum purchase through gift of various donors; 1901-39-1518
